III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Allegations 1: Youth are not given phone calls and visits per the
facility policy.
Allegations 2: The medications are not stored in accordance with
the facility policy.
Investigation Allegation 1:
Interviews:
Complainant was this DCWL Licensing Consultant.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on July
24, 2025. Youth C stated he was only allowed one 10-minute
phone call to family per week, noting that he does not feel that is
enough time to connect with family per week. Youth C stated he
has not had any family visits scheduled in the two weeks he has
been placed despite his mother asking to come visits.
Staff 1 and Staff 2 were interviewed face-to face at the facility
on July 24, 2025. Staff 1 and Staff 2 confirmed youth are allowed
one 10-minute phone call per week to family. Staff 1 noted it was
due to the facility only having access to two cellular phones as the
phone system was not “up and running”. Staff 1 and Staff 2 both
confirmed family visits for all youth have not begun to date. Staff 2
noted the visit room was being used by contractors and recently
became available and therefore was going to be cleaned and set
up as a family visit space for the youth.
A phone conversation occurred with Director on July 29,
2025. Director reported the phones were recently installed and
became operational. Director reported that family visits can take
up to three weeks to set up and schedule and Youth C had only
been placed for about two weeks which was why Youth C had not
had any visits to date.
Documents Reviewed:
• Michigan Youth Treatment Center Resident and Family
Visitation Policy was reviewed. The policy states “visits will
typically occur once per week, though exceptions may be
made based on individualized treatment plans or other
extenuating circumstances.”
• Michigan Youth Treatment Center Communication Policy
was reviewed. The policy states “Youth are permitted two
(2) scheduled phone calls per week, each lasting up to 15
minutes.”
2

Allegation 2:
Complainant was this DCWL Licensing Consultant.
Tour Observation:
A tour of the facility occurred on July 24, 2025. The medications
were viewed sitting in an opened unlocked lockbox on the nurse’s
desk. The nurse’s office door was locked and the hallway leading
into the nurse’s office space was locked.
Documents Reviewed:
• Michigan Youth Treatment Center Health Services Policy
was reviewed. The policy states “All medications, including
over-the-counter medications, and equipment to administer
medications will be stored in a secure, locked cabinet or
medication cart that is accessible only to authorized
personnel.”
Analysis Allegation 1:
The agency is found in non-compliance as per youth and staff
interviews and documentation review the agency is not following
their communication and family visit policy.
Allegation 2:
The agency is found in non-compliance as per tour observation
and policy review, the medications were not being stored per the
agency’s policy.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4162 Seclusion within secure and nonsecure
Section facilities; seclusion plan; prohibitions; reduction and
Description elimination
(11) All seclusion will be prohibited effective November 1, 2022.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth are locked in their bedrooms during shower time.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was this DCWL Licensing Consultant.
Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C were interviewed face-to-face
at the facility on July 24, 2025. Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C all
reported they were being locked in their bedrooms for
approximately 45 minutes during shower time.
Staff 1 and Staff 2 were interviewed face-to-face at the facility
on July 24, 2025. Staff 1 and Staff 2 confirmed that the procedure
during shower time was to lock all youth that were not showering
3

in their bedrooms until all youth have taken turns showering and
then they are released.
A phone conversation occurred with Director on July 29,
2025. Director reported it was his understanding that due to PREA
the facility was allowed and even encouraged to place youth in
their bedrooms for safety reasons during shower time. Director
reported this was the operating procedure at his prior facility and
DCWL Licensing Consultant was aware and never told him this
was not approved or allowed therefore it was carried over to this
program.
Documents Reviewed:
• Michigan Youth Treatment Center Seclusion Variance dated
June 6, 2025, was reviewed. The variance does not allow
for youth to be secluded during shower time.
• Michigan Youth Treatment Center Use of Seclusion Policy
was reviewed. The policy does not allow for use of
seclusion during shower time and has very specific
expectations for the use of seclusion, the monitoring during
seclusions, and assessments and notification for post-
seclusion.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as per staff and youth
interviews, the youth are being secluded in their bedrooms during
shower time which is prohibited.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
